_comment: C2 Container Level Template - Complete schema with examples and documentation
_description: Template for documenting containers (deployable/runnable units) within each system. Each container represents a separately deployable part of the architecture.

parent._comment: Parent timestamp must be earlier than this file's timestamp

containers._comment: Example container - Remove or replace with actual containers
containers._id_comment: REQUIRED: Unique identifier in kebab-case. Used for file naming and cross-references.
containers.name: Example API Server
containers._name_comment: REQUIRED: Human-readable name for the container
containers._type_comment: REQUIRED: Container type. Valid values: web-server, app-server, database, cache, message-broker, spa, api, worker, file-storage
_type_options: web-server - HTTP servers like Nginx, Apache
app-server - Application runtime servers (Node.js, Python, Java)
spa - Single Page Applications (runs in browser)
api - API gateways or dedicated API servers
containers._system_id_comment: REQUIRED: Parent system ID (must match an ID from c1-systems.json)
containers.responsibility: Provides REST API endpoints for client applications, handles business logic, and manages data persistence
containers._responsibility_comment: REQUIRED: Clear description of what this container does and why it exists

technology._comment: Technology stack information - what this container is built with
technology._primary_language_comment: REQUIRED: Main programming language (e.g., JavaScript, Python, Java, Go, TypeScript)
technology._framework_comment: REQUIRED: Primary framework/runtime (e.g., Express.js, Django, Spring Boot, Next.js)

libraries.name: sequelize
libraries.purpose: ORM for database access and schema management
libraries._comment: Each library should document name, version, and why it's used

technology._libraries_comment: OPTIONAL: Array of key libraries/dependencies. Include name, version, and purpose for each.

runtime._comment: Runtime environment information - where and how this container runs
runtime._environment_comment: REQUIRED: Where it runs. Valid values: browser, server, cloud, edge, mobile
runtime._platform_comment: REQUIRED: Execution platform details (e.g., 'Node.js 18.x on Linux', 'Python 3.11 on Docker', 'Browser (Chrome/Firefox/Safari)')
runtime._containerized_comment: REQUIRED: Boolean - is this deployed in containers (Docker/Kubernetes)?
runtime._container_technology_comment: REQUIRED IF containerized=true: Container technology details (e.g., 'Docker', 'Docker with Kubernetes', 'Docker Compose')

observations._id_comment: REQUIRED: Unique observation identifier in kebab-case (pattern: ^obs-[a-z0-9-]+$)
observations.title: Outdated Express.js Version
observations._title_comment: OPTIONAL: Short title for the observation
observations._category_comment: REQUIRED: Observation category. Valid values: technology, runtime, communication, data-storage, authentication, deployment, scalability, performance, dependencies, configuration, monitoring, security
_category_options: technology - Language, framework, library choices and patterns
communication - How this container communicates (protocols, APIs)
data-storage - Database access, caching, file storage patterns
scalability - Horizontal/vertical scaling capabilities and patterns
dependencies - External dependencies and library usage
configuration - Configuration management and environment variables
observations._severity_comment: REQUIRED: Severity level. Valid values: critical, warning, info
_severity_options: critical - Security vulnerabilities, breaking issues, must fix
warning - Performance issues, technical debt, should fix
info - Informational findings, best practices, nice to have
observations.description: Using outdated Express.js version with known security vulnerabilities
observations._description_comment: REQUIRED: Clear description of the observation
observations.impact: Exposes application to known CVE vulnerabilities including remote code execution and denial of service attacks
observations._impact_comment: OPTIONAL: Impact description for critical/warning observations
observations.recommendation: Upgrade to Express.js 4.18.2 or later to patch known security vulnerabilities
observations._recommendation_comment: OPTIONAL: Recommended action for critical/warning observations

evidence._location_comment: REQUIRED: Where this was found (file:line or file path)
evidence._type_comment: OPTIONAL: Evidence type (config, code, text, yaml, etc.)
evidence._snippet_comment: OPTIONAL: Code snippet or relevant excerpt

observations._evidence_comment: OPTIONAL: Array of supporting evidence for this observation
observations._tags_comment: OPTIONAL: Array of tags for categorization and search

observations.title: Missing Database Connection Pool
observations.description: No connection pooling detected for database connections
observations.impact: May lead to connection exhaustion under high load and degraded performance
observations.recommendation: Implement connection pooling using Sequelize pool configuration

containers._observations_comment: OPTIONAL: Array of observations about this container. Each observation documents findings, patterns, or notable characteristics.

relations._target_comment: REQUIRED: Target container ID (must match another container's ID)
relations._type_comment: REQUIRED: Relation type. Valid values: http-rest, http-graphql, grpc, websocket, database-connection, database-query, database-write, database-read-write, cache-access, cache-read, cache-write, cache-read-write, message-publish, message-subscribe, message-consumer, file-read, file-write, cdn-fetch, stream
_type_options: http-rest - REST API calls over HTTP/HTTPS
database-write - Database write operations (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE)
database-read-write - Database read and write operations
cache-read-write - Cache read and write operations
message-subscribe - Subscribes to messages from queue/broker
relations.description: Connects to PostgreSQL for persistent data storage using connection pool
relations._description_comment: REQUIRED: Description in active voice describing what this relation does

relations.description: Uses Redis for session storage and API response caching
Consumes job tasks from the 'tasks' queue for background processing

containers._relations_comment: OPTIONAL: Array of relations to other containers. Documents how containers communicate and depend on each other.

_frontmatter_requirements._comment: Markdown frontmatter generated from container JSON
_frontmatter_requirements.title: From container.name

id_format.system_id: Must match an ID from c1-systems.json

timestamp_rules.metadata.timestamp: ISO 8601 format, must be after parent.timestamp

_markdown_structure._comment: Structure of generated markdown files (from generate-c2-markdown.py)
sections: 5. Observations (grouped by category, sorted by severity)

_usage_notes.when_to_create: After C1 systems are identified and documented
_usage_notes.one_container_per: Separately deployable/runnable unit (microservice, database, SPA, etc.)
_usage_notes.technology_focus: Document the tech stack, not implementation details
_usage_notes.runtime_focus: Document where and how it runs, containerization approach
_usage_notes.observations_focus: Key findings about technology choices, architecture, performance, security
_usage_notes.relations_focus: How containers communicate - protocols and patterns
_usage_notes.cross_references: system_id must reference C1 system, relation targets must reference other containers
